EmailTemplate.name: Cross SBU.Toronto PEI Legal Entity Notification 07.13.2015
EmailTemplate.subject: Notice of Honeywell Aerospace Legal Entity/Name Change for Toronto and Prince Edward Island (PEI) Canada
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear Customer,
At Honeywell Aerospace, it is always our intent to notify you in advance of a change to our business operations. Regrettably, we recently changed the legal entity name of our Canadian facilities and inadvertently failed to provide an advanced notification. We apologize for any disruption or inconvenience this may have caused.
What has changed:
Honeywell ASCa, Inc. has legally changed its name to Honeywell Limited as of July 1, 2015. This entity includes the Toronto and PEI sites. The name and address (shipping information) is noted below:
From: To:
Honeywell ASCa Honeywell Aerospace Toronto 3333 Unity Drive Mississauga, Ontario Canada L5L 3S6
Honeywell Limited Honeywell Aerospace Toronto 3333 Unity Drive Mississauga, Ontario Canada L5L 3S6
Honeywell ASCa Honeywell Aerospace PEI 800 Aerospace Blvd., Hangar 8, PO Box 194 Slemon Park, PEI Canada C0B2A0
Honeywell Limited Honeywell Aerospace PEI 800 Aerospace Blvd., Hangar 8, PO Box 194 Slemon Park, PEI Canada C0B2A0
Some of the documents may include the old name and/or the new name. If there is an inconsistency in the references to the name, please contact your Honeywell representative to correct this inconsistency.
What this means to you:
- Please update your internal purchasing, authorized supplier list and quality management system (QMS) to reflect this legal entity name change.
- Future purchase orders (“POs”) should include the new legal entity name.
- Orders for current work in process will reflect the new legal entity name on shipping, airworthiness, and invoice documents. If you require that POs for current work in process match the applicable documentation, then please update your POs prior to shipment by sending an updated PO to:
- Repairs: aerorepairs@honeywell.com <mailto:aerorepairs@honeywell.com> - Spares: orderchanges@honeywell.com <mailto:orderchanges@honeywell.com>
- OEM: your assigned customer business manager
- Honeywell’s repair station licenses and processes are not impacted other than the new legal entity/name change.
Documents impacted by the legal entity/name change include:
- Customer specific labels (Label on Shipment Box) - Commercial Shipper - Repair Estimate/Service Estimate (Repair Quote Form) - Invoice (Invoice/Credit/Debit Memo) - Government DD250 (Military Shipper) - Order Acknowledge Form - Return Material Authorization - Service Report/Finding/Cafe - Commercial Invoice/Global Customs Document - Form One-E (Transport Canada Form One)/CAAC
If you have any questions or concerns, please contact your Honeywell business focal or email AeroCPSCommunications@Honeywell.com.
Please click on links for a copy of the site certifications: Mississauga TCCA Aero Products Certification <https://pages3.honeywell.com/rs/641-QIX-912/images/TCCA Manuf Cert 2015.pdf> Mississauga TCCA Avionics Components Certification <https://pages3.honeywell.com/rs/641-QIX-912/images/TCCA AMO cert 2015.pdf> Prince Edward Island TCCA Components NDT Certification <https://pages3.honeywell.com/rs/641-QIX-912/images/HONEYWELL_AEROSPACE_PEI_AMENDED_AMO_CERTIFICA....pdf>
Again, our apologies for the delayed notification.
Heath Patrick Vice President Customer and Product Support Honeywell Aerospace
